title: To 'mage supports' (there is some salt at the start, but please read)
body:
This is a very salty post, but just please listen (or read). Why did I have to get matched with a support (I know this was in normals but who cares) that didn't buy a sightstone and put the LEAST amount of wards in the team. Like WTF. I know it's normals and they don't really matter, but seriously, this support put down 8 wards and just built full AP? It was a Lux support aswell.

So to the people that play support as someone like Lux or Annie: there is NO excuse for you to not buy a sightstone in a game. If you don't do this, then just don't play support. This doesn't mean that you shouldn't build any AP, it means that you should ALWAYS buy a sightstone. And you see this item {{item:2301}}? This item right here gives you AP AND wards!

So instead of just building full AP and acting like the mid laner, if you're playing a mage support, Eye of the Watchers should be like the first item you get. There should not be an excuse for you to not buy a sighstone as a support.

replies.body: Anyone who legit calls themselves a "Support Main" (I do) understands the power of Vision Control.  It's the auto-fills that have no idea what the role does that think you'll do better without one.

I am a Support main that leans towards the AP playstyle. 

I buy a {{item:2301}} every single game. It is critical to vision.
I feel like when a Lux/annie support doesn't build a sightstone they are just thinking "la da di i have no {{item:2049}} but i has {{item:3089}} :D"

I play mage supports and always get eye, unless my ADC is complete shit (0/6 with 32 CS at 15m) and i am ahead, in which case i direct them to buy {{item:2302}} for the wards and gold income, and when they rage, simply ignore them.

Playing mage supports in public matched games is a sort of insurance policy; if you detect your adc is complete trash, you can just begin kill(steal)ing, ignore them, and proceed to play like a midlaner, thus giving your team a 4v5 instead of a 3v5 situation.
